data.title: My Masculinity Is ‘Jupiter Ascending’
data.meta_description: I stream movies when I work at home because my last job was in an open office and that experience ruined me. I just can’t concentrate anymore without noise and movement in the background. For…
data.text:
I stream movies when I work at home because my last job was in an open office and that experience ruined me. I just can’t concentrate anymore without noise and movement in the background.

For instance, my favorite movie to stream while I work is the Lord of the Rings trilogy. I will type-type-type, turn around in time for Gandalf to shout “You shall not pass,” and then I return to type-type-typing.

But recently I chose a movie I had never seen called Jupiter Ascending. It’s a big-budget space opera from 2015 directed by the Wachowski siblings, the filmmakers who directed The Matrix.

The pair have also directed quirky blockbusters like Speed Racer and Cloud Atlas but those two movies, beloved by many, were box-office flops, like Jupiter Ascending.

The Matrix, however, was a blockbuster. Some consider it a masterpiece. Dudes, mostly. The sunglasses and shiny leather and slow-motion kung-fu, they love that shit. I was really into The Matrix when I first saw it in 1999.

I pressed “play” on Jupiter Ascending because I assumed it was two-hours of aliens, lasers, and explosions. It looked like something I didn’t have to pay attention to. A movie I could watch out of the…
